* The invention allows imaging in multiple planes, useful for various image formats.
  * It can be used for simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or surface imaging of passageways.
  * Doped layers create a waveguide-like structure for edge detection.

* The image sensor includes photodiodes and buried-channel CCDs for charge collection and transfer.
  * Photons impinging on imaging planes generate charge carriers collected in photodiodes.
  * Charge carriers are transferred to CCDs and shifted out by clock phase terminals.

* A second embodiment extends N-type regions to the edges, improving charge collection and reducing crosstalk.
  * This increases the lateral extent of the depletion region.
  * It enhances the probability of charge collection adjacent to edges.

* The image sensor can be used in various applications, including color imaging.
  * Color filters can be applied to different imaging planes for single-pass color scanning.
  * The invention is compatible with existing image sensor processing techniques.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses power management in home networks by transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
    • A network master node consumes significant power even when not performing its nominal functions.
    • Energy Star guidelines require devices to reduce power consumption when not performing nominal functions.
    • The invention allows a network master node to enter power management mode by transferring its functions to a slave node.

• The invention proposes a system where a slave node can become a master node to minimize power consumption.
    • A slave node can automatically promote itself to master if the current master fails or goes offline.
    • The system ensures the best-qualified slave node is promoted to master to optimize network performance.
    • This approach prevents network loss when the master node enters power save mode.

• The invention includes methods for transferring network administrative functions to manage power consumption.
    • A first device in active power state sends data to a second device to perform network functions.
    • The first device enters power management state after transferring functions.
    • The second device accepts the transfer and performs network administrative functions.

• The home network includes devices like video and audio servers connected via a network medium.
    • Devices perform specific nominal functions, such as streaming video or audio.
    • The network medium can be a powerline, wired, or wireless network.
    • Devices can serve as both master and slave nodes, with some only as slave nodes.

• The network master node performs administrative functions in addition to nominal functions.
    • Functions include beacon transmission, device association, and bandwidth assignment.
    • Master nodes require sufficient processing power and memory.
    • The M/S DNI enables devices to perform administrative functions and connect to the network.

• The invention provides a flow for a master node to transfer functions to a slave node.
    • The master node receives instructions to enter power management mode.
    • It sends data to a slave node to transfer administrative functions.
    • The master node enters power management mode, and the slave becomes the new master.

• The invention provides a flow for a slave node to accept and perform master functions.
    • The slave node receives a transfer request from the master node.
    • It sends a request reply indicating acceptance of the transfer.
    • The slave node receives the functions and becomes the new master.

• The invention includes criteria for selecting the best-qualified slave node to become master.
    • Selection can be based on visibility, intelligence, or user preference.
    • The process ensures optimal network administration and power management.
    • The

<summary>
• The invention relates to antenna arrangements for measuring the direction of electromagnetic radiation.
  • It addresses challenges in measuring low elevation angles due to ground reflections.
  • The invention builds on U.K. Patent No. 1449196, which used a triplet arrangement to measure elevation angles.

• The prior art involves using equi-spaced triplets of antenna elements.
  • These triplets help determine elevation angles independent of ground reflection coefficients.
  • The quotient of specific signal functions is independent of several variables, aiding in accurate measurements.

• The invention aims to overcome ambiguity in angle measurements.
  • It uses at least four antennas to form two equi-spaced triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
  • The system processes signals to derive elevation angles without interference from ground reflections.

• The antenna array can operate in both receive and transmit modes.
  • In receive mode, signal processing circuits provide unambiguous angle measurements.
  • In transmit mode, coded signals from each antenna enable angle derivation in remote receivers.

• The invention includes logic means for signal processing.
  • First logic means combine signals from outermost antennas to derive a first signal.
  • Second logic means derive a second signal from the center antenna, and dividing means provide a quotient signal.

• The invention is exemplified with three triplets for practical applications.
  • The triplets are optimized for specific elevation angles to maximize measurement accuracy.
  • The arrangement allows for unambiguous sector coverage from 0.5 to 7 degrees.

• The design aims for minimal antenna elements and optimal measurement integrity.
  • Values for spacing and height are calculated for sensitive measurements.
  • A weighted average of readings from triplets ensures optimal results.

• The invention is applicable to monitoring aircraft height during landing.
  • It provides accurate elevation angle measurements for secondary surveillance radar systems.
  • The system can be adapted for various civil and military applications.

• The invention includes a circuit for measuring the squared quotient of signals.
  • Superheterodyne receivers are used for sensitivity and dynamic range.
  • The circuit measures decay time to derive the required quotient, independent of signal amplitude.

• An alternative application involves coding angles in space through radio transmissions.
  • Triplets are energized with coherent carriers and amplitude modulation.
  • Quotients derived from modulation sidebands provide elevation angles in remote receivers.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses issues with traditional subminiature lamps, such as adhesive breakdown, thermal expansion, and moisture ingress.
    • Adhesive used in lamps degrades due to thermal cycling and cleaning, leading to lamp failure.
    • Moisture ingress through adhesive cracks causes corrosion and early lamp failure.
    • Existing solutions like O-rings are ineffective due to manufacturing challenges and limited sealing capabilities.

• The invention proposes a subminiature lamp assembly using a high-temperature polymer for improved performance.
    • The polymer directly surrounds the glass envelope, providing a liquid-tight seal.
    • A fluoroelastomer is preferred for its chemical resistance and high-temperature tolerance.
    • The polymeric material offers extended sealing, heat resistance, and ease of handling.

• The invention includes a polymeric seal support that encapsulates the glass envelope and base.
    • The seal support is non-thermally conducting and withstands high temperatures.
    • It forms a longer seal length compared to conventional O-rings, enhancing durability.
    • The seal support can be customized for different lamp configurations and support needs.

• The invention eliminates the need for adhesives, improving lamp centering and stability.
    • Adhesives create uneven application and off-center lamp positioning.
    • The polymeric seal support allows closer tolerance centering without adhesive.
    • The stretch ratio of the seal support holds the lamp securely in place.

• The invention minimizes air volume and potential contamination within the lamp assembly.
    • Potting material can be used to fill cavities and stabilize electrical leads.
    • The potting material provides additional protection against axial compression.
    • The seal support prevents wicking and contamination from external sources.

• The invention offers improved sealing and protection against environmental factors.
    • The polymeric seal support maintains a seal during operation and sterilization.
    • It resists chemical attack and maintains integrity across temperature ranges.
    • The seal support reduces the risk of burns by insulating the lamp assembly.

• The invention provides a solution for medical and other high-demand applications.
    • It addresses the need for reliable, long-lasting subminiature lamps.
    • The seal support enhances safety and performance in medical environments.
    • The invention can be adapted for various applications requiring insulation and resistance.

• The invention reduces the number of sealing points and maximizes seal surface length.
    • The polymeric seal support creates a static radial seal with the glass envelope.
    • It eliminates the need for multiple sealing points, simplifying assembly.
    • The seal support's design minimizes

<summary>

• The invention relates to precoder configuration in MIMO systems, specifically focusing on reducing computational costs in GDFE precoders for MU-MIMO systems.
  • GDFE precoders provide optimal capacity but are computationally expensive.
  • The invention proposes a method to reduce computational costs without capacity loss.

• The invention introduces a method for configuring a GDFE-based precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system.
  • The method involves computing a filter matrix C using alternative formulas.
  • Based on C, it computes transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G.

• The invention provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE precoder.
  • It relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix Szz.
  • The method does not require channel reduction when the input covariance matrix Sxx is rank deficient.

• The invention describes the system model and relevant prior art.
  • It includes definitions of key matrices and parameters used in the system.
  • The transmitter and receiver processing steps are detailed.

• The invention presents methods to compute GDFE precoder matrices.
  • It includes a method that avoids using Szz for computing matrix C.
  • Alternative methods for computing C are provided for different channel matrix conditions.

• Numerical examples illustrate the computation of matrices involved in the GDFE precoder design.
  • Examples demonstrate the application of the proposed methods in different scenarios.
  • They highlight the effectiveness of the invention in reducing computational costs.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention focuses on a heat-dissipating device and housing, specifically an axial fan with improved airflow without altering assembly conditions.
  • The fan enhances heat dissipation by increasing intake airflow through an outwardly extending sidewall.
  • The housing design maintains compatibility with existing systems and heat dissipation elements.
  • The invention aims to improve heat-dissipating efficiency by enlarging the intake area and allowing for larger impeller dimensions.

• The housing includes an outer frame with a passage for air streams, featuring a sidewall that extends radially outward.
  • The sidewall extension can be symmetrical and may protrude beyond the outer frame.
  • The design can be frustum-conical or frustum-elliptically conical, with inclined portions or beveled edges.
  • The passage's sidewall at the air inlet side extends outward to increase the intake area.

• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and housing, with a passage for guiding air streams.
  • The sidewall at the air inlet side extends outward to enlarge the intake area.
  • The impeller blade dimensions increase with the sidewall's outward extension.
  • The design allows for concentrated air streams to enhance heat dissipation.

• The invention includes a heat-dissipating system with a casing, electrical elements, and a heat-dissipating device.
  • The device features an impeller and housing with a passage for air streams.
  • The sidewall at one of the openings extends outward to enlarge the intake/discharge area.
  • The system can include a heat sink assembled with the housing.

• The invention's design allows for various modifications to enhance heat-dissipating efficiency.
  • The sidewall can extend outward in different shapes, such as circular or elliptical.
  • Notches can be added to the sidewall to increase lateral intake airflow.
  • The design can be adapted to fit within dimensional limitations.

• The heat-dissipating device can be used with a heat sink for enhanced cooling.
  • The device can be mounted to a CPU, with the heat sink in contact with the CPU surface.
  • The inclined portion of the sidewall guides air streams to the heat sink's hottest area.
  • The design improves heat dissipation by concentrating airflow on the heat sink.

• The invention's design enhances airflow and heat dissipation without altering assembly conditions.
  • The outward extension of the housing increases the air inlet and outlet areas.
  • Larger imp

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel capable of displaying images in different colors without using an intermediate electrode.
    * The panel is designed to display green light at low voltage and lemon light at high voltage, suitable for day and night use in automobiles.
    * The structure includes various layers laminated on a glass substrate, with first and second luminescent layers emitting different colors.
    * The display panel is cost-effective due to its simplified structure, eliminating the need for an intermediate electrode.
    * The invention addresses the problem of complex and expensive structures in previous designs.

* The display panel's design allows for color changes by adjusting the voltage level.
    * The first luminescent layer emits light without visible red components, while the second layer emits light with visible red components.
    * The panel can display green light at night and lemon light during the day, providing comfort and high luminance.
    * The design includes a matrix of electrode stripes forming picture elements, allowing for pattern displays.
    * The panel can also use color filters to achieve different color displays at varying voltage levels.

* The invention includes multiple embodiments with variations in design and materials.
    * The first embodiment features a stripe-shaped double layer portion, while the second uses a square shape for better visual comfort.
    * The third embodiment adds a red color filter, allowing for red light emission at high luminance.
    * The fourth embodiment eliminates the second luminescent layer, using a color filter to achieve color changes.
    * The fifth embodiment modifies the first luminescent layer with thicker portions to compensate for luminance attenuation by the color filter.

* The manufacturing process involves forming layers on a glass substrate using sputtering and vapor deposition techniques.
    * The first electrodes are made of ITO, and insulation layers are formed using materials like SiO x N y and Ta 2 O 5.
    * The luminescent layers are made of ZnS with added luminescent centers like TbOF and Mn.
    * The process includes heat treatment and etching to form the desired layer shapes and patterns.
    * The final structure includes transparent electrodes and insulation layers for optimal light emission.

* The invention offers flexibility in material choices and design modifications.
    * Different luminescent centers can be used in the luminescent layers to achieve various color emissions.
    * The design can be adapted for pattern displays by shaping the electrodes accordingly.
    * Additional features like black pigment coating can enhance the display's visual appeal.
    * The invention

<summary>
• The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, aiming to provide a low-cost alternative to traditional telephony by using the Internet for data transmission.
  • The terminal includes audio means for sound reproduction and recording, converting means for data format conversion, and protocol means for communication control using standardized protocols like TCP/IP.
  • It features wireless communication capabilities, such as Bluetooth, to connect with a network or the Internet without needing specialized equipment, enhancing mobility and reducing power consumption.
  • The system includes a service server with databases for user information, enabling functionalities like chat-lines and telephone meetings, and supports dynamic IP address allocation for greater user mobility.

• The invention also encompasses a method for Internet/network telephony, involving sound reproduction, data conversion, and communication handling using standardized protocols.
  • The method includes wireless near-field communication with a connecting unit to establish network connections, embedding/extracting data packets in/from a wireless data format.
  • It supports additional functionalities like speech recognition for command identification and communication in various wireless protocols, such as Bluetooth and DECT.
  • The method can be implemented in devices like ear telephones or headsets, providing a compact, hands-free communication solution with low power consumption.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses challenges in integrating high-dielectric oxide materials with semiconductor substrates, particularly silicon and gallium arsenide, by using germanium buffer layers.
  • Germanium buffer layers reduce the formation of low dielectric constant layers and enhance epitaxial growth, allowing for the integration of ferroelectric materials like barium strontium titanate and lead zirconate titanate.
  • The use of germanium is compatible with silicon process technology and helps prevent reactions that degrade the dielectric properties of the materials.

• The invention proposes a method and structure for semiconductor circuitry involving non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide buffer layers.
  • A germanium layer is epitaxially grown on the semiconductor substrate, followed by the deposition of a non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer, which acts as a buffer for Pb/Bi-containing oxides.
  • This structure allows for the creation of non-volatile memory cells and other semiconductor devices with improved dielectric properties and reduced diffusion issues.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses the challenge of balancing small and large signal behavior with low production costs in receiver input circuits.
  * Known circuits use semiconductor components and amplification control, but face issues with non-linearity and signal distortions.
  * Siemens publications describe circuits using PIN diode control networks to manage amplification and protect components.

* The invention proposes a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops to reduce distortions.
  * A third control loop with lower response threshold and frequency bandwidth is introduced to complement existing loops.
  * The control signal is derived from the intermediate frequency signal and applied before the mixer stage.

* The invention's principle is illustrated with several amplification control circuits in a receiver input circuit.
  * Control signals are obtained from different stages, including preamplifier, mixer, and intermediate frequency amplifier.
  * Amplification is controlled jointly in the input network using processed control signals.

* The first and second control loops prevent overloading of mixer stages and varactor diodes.
  * The first loop avoids unwanted overloading with a band width similar to the transmission band width.
  * The second loop prevents overloading from powerful signals with a narrower band width than the first loop.

* The third control loop supports other circuits with lower band width and response threshold.
  * It can reduce the response threshold based on spurious signal levels.
  * This helps protect the input circuit from strong spurious signals.

* An embodiment of the input circuit includes a PIN diode for controllable signal attenuation.
  * The circuit maintains constant operating power during control, reducing temperature changes.
  * PIN diode control protects against high-voltage discharge surges from the antenna.

* Additional embodiments show extended input networks with higher selectivity and control range.
  * Tunable networks with varactor diodes allow for iteration-free alignment of tuning circuits.
  * A twin diode configuration offers high identity of C(U) characteristics, simplifying tuning voltage adjustments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to network-based shared workspace environments, specifically for setting up collaborative work-sharing between distant individuals.
  * Traditional video conferencing systems are costly and require dedicated equipment.
  * PC-based products like Intel's ProShare™ and Microsoft's NetMeeting™ offer economical alternatives but are complex for non-technical users.
  * The invention simplifies the setup process, allowing collaboration via a button on a telephone set.

* The system uses a collaboration button and indicator on telephones to initiate a work-share environment during a call.
  * The indicator lights up if richer collaboration is possible between the parties.
  * Activating the collaboration button runs network-enabled applications on users' desktops.
  * The voice connection remains unaffected during the collaboration setup.

* The preferred embodiment includes a telephone and PC connected to a LAN, with collaboration control programs on each PC.
  * The collaboration control program communicates with the phone to manage the indicator and button.
  * It compares local and remote collaboration applications to determine compatibility.
  * The program can launch or foreground collaboration applications on the desktop.

* The system architecture supports both LAN and Internet connections, allowing geographical flexibility.
  * Stations can be connected via the Internet or PSTN, with collaboration capabilities determined by protocols.
  * Fax capabilities can be integrated as a form of collaboration.
  * The system can be implemented in various configurations, including peer-to-peer and client-server architectures.

* The invention can be deployed in systems where voice transport is via data networks, but also on dedicated telephone systems.
  * The telephone and PC may be physically connected or separate.
  * The invention can be implemented as a computer program on various carrier media.
  * Alternative embodiments and variations are within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on optimizing the visual impact of advertising clips inserted into video sequences by ensuring continuity between regions of interest in the video and the ad.
  * It uses salience maps to determine regions of interest in both the video sequence and advertising clips.
  * The advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity in salience to the video sequence is selected for insertion.

* The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and each advertising clip, then calculating a degree of similarity.
  * Similarity can be determined using correlation coefficients, Kullback-Leibler divergence, or Euclidean distances between salient points.
  * The advertising clip with the highest similarity is inserted at a predefined insertion point, often at a shot change.

* The device implementing this method includes components like memory, a processing unit, and interfaces for input/output and user interaction.
  * It processes the video sequence and advertising clips, inserting the selected clip at the determined insertion point.
  * The enhanced video sequence is stored for future use or further processing.

* The invention allows for flexibility in insertion points, which can be predefined, manually selected, or automatically detected.
  * Advertising clips can be inserted at points other than shot changes, such as specific metadata-defined points or regular intervals.
  * The method can be combined with other selection processes based on semantic content or viewer profiles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses challenges in semiconductor devices with dimensions below 150 nanometers by using a recessed mask structure to prevent high electric fields at material interfaces, reducing leakage and breakdown.
  • It is particularly useful in damascene-type structures, where a mask member is positioned below the surface to be planarized, minimizing electric field concentration and maintaining the integrity of conductive liners.
  • The invention allows for reduced capacitance and faster signal propagation by minimizing the thickness of high-k mask materials and positioning them away from high electric field points.
  
• The recessed mask structure is achieved through a process that involves removing mask material after chemical-mechanical polishing to a level away from high electric field points.
  • This process allows for a final mask thickness that is no thicker than necessary, reducing overall capacitance and enhancing device performance.
  • The invention also provides flexibility in using different materials and meeting processing specifications by minimizing damage to conductive liners during planarization.

• The invention offers several benefits, including lower and predictable overall capacitance, faster signal propagation, and minimized damage to conductive liners.
  • It achieves these benefits by positioning the high-k mask material in a recessed manner between conductors, away from high electric field points.
  • The structure is made using standard substrates and involves etching and deposition processes to establish the desired mask and cap interfaces.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on designing radio receivers using digital signal processing (DSP) techniques to improve analog-to-digital conversion.
  * It addresses issues in conventional RF receivers, such as phase errors and amplitude mismatches, by digitizing the intermediate frequency (IF) signal directly.
  * The invention utilizes predictive coding principles to simplify the design and improve performance by eliminating discrete-time analog circuitry.

* The Downconverting Digitizer performs three main functions: digitization, downconversion to baseband, and automatic gain control.
  * It consists of various components, including a variable gain amplifier, predictive digital filter, and digital quadrature mixer, to achieve these functions.
  * The design minimizes the analog section, maximizing the use of DSP techniques for flexibility and performance.

* The predictive filter is central to the invention, using DSP techniques to generate a prediction of the input signal.
  * It allows dynamic adjustment of filter characteristics to match the input signal, enhancing dynamic range and reducing quantization noise.
  * The digital implementation offers advantages over analog designs, such as stability and reprogrammability.

* The invention includes an automatic gain control (AGC) loop to maintain signal amplitude within the dynamic range of the predictive loop.
  * The AGC loop uses the predictive filter output to control the gain of the variable gain amplifier.
  * This approach effectively removes the slowly varying component of the signal's dynamic range, optimizing performance.

* An offset nuller dynamically detects and removes offsets that could impair conversion, eliminating the need for manual calibration.
  * The offset nuller loop continuously estimates and corrects offsets during operation.
  * This feature enhances the accuracy and reliability of the analog-to-digital conversion process.

* The invention was implemented and verified in a wireless telephone receiver, demonstrating significant dynamic range and performance improvements.
  * The implementation used a CMOS process and achieved over 52 dB of dynamic range without AGC, extending to over 124 dB with AGC.
  * The design offers a cost-effective solution with reduced noise and complexity compared to traditional methods.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on using nanoimprint lithography to fabricate sensors with nano-scale features for detecting molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules.
  * Nanoimprint lithography allows for the creation of semiconductor nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used for multiplex detection of analytes.
  * The method provides a cost-effective and reproducible way to fabricate arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer.
  * Changes in electrical conductivity of the semiconducting active layer are monitored to detect binding of complementary targets to anchored probe molecules.

* The fabrication process involves several steps, including the deposition of gate electrodes, dielectric layers, and semiconducting active layers.
  * Nanoimprint lithography is used to pattern semiconductor nanotraces over the interdigitated finger regions of source and drain electrodes.
  * The process includes the use of a quartz template with grooves to create the desired pattern on the semiconductor layer.
  * A series of dry etch processes are used to transfer the pattern into the semiconductor active layer, forming the nanotraces.

* The sensors are functionalized with probe molecules that have specific affinities for different targets, allowing for multiplex detection.
  * Probe molecules are covalently attached to the surface of the semiconductor nanotraces, with each sensor device receiving a unique sensitizing compound.
  * The method of PhotoGenerated Reagent (PGR) is used to synthesize nucleic acid sequences directly on the semiconductor nanotraces.
  * The multiplex detection array is packaged onto an electronics board for signal acquisition and processing, enabling detection of target molecules through changes in electrical current.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention addresses the issue of oxidation on the side surfaces of semiconductor package leads by introducing a method for singulating and plating these surfaces.
  • The method involves singulating semiconductor packages from a common leadframe and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a material that prevents oxidation, such as tin, silver, or gold.
• The invention provides various embodiments for the singulation and plating process, including full and partial cutting techniques.
  • Full cutting involves a single operation to separate the packages, while partial cutting uses multiple steps, allowing for plating between cuts and creating different side surface profiles.
• The invention includes detailed descriptions of the singulation and plating processes, as well as the resulting semiconductor package designs.
  • The designs feature plated side surfaces that improve solderability and prevent oxidation, with options for straight or beveled side profiles achieved through different cutting techniques.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention addresses a dual mode mobile terminal that can connect to both wireless wide area networks (WWAN) and wireless local area networks (WLAN).
  * It aims to solve the problem of dropped connections when switching from WLAN to WWAN by using gathered service information to expedite the connection process.

* Fixed Mobile Convergence (FMC) integrates WWAN and WLAN, allowing mobile terminals to switch between networks based on signal strength.
  * The invention proposes turning off the GSM module when connected to WLAN to save power and turning it on when the WLAN signal weakens.

* The mobile terminal uses service information from WLAN access points to reduce connection setup time when switching to WWAN.
  * This service information includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes from neighboring WWAN base stations.

* The invention describes a method for selecting a serving base station in a communication system with both WWAN and WLAN.
  * The method involves turning on the first wireless module based on signal thresholds and using service information to select a base station.

* The mobile terminal contains two wireless modules: one for WWAN and one for WLAN, which can be selectively turned on or off.
  * The WLAN access point gathers service information from WWAN base stations and transmits it to the mobile terminal.

* The invention allows for seamless switching between WLAN and WWAN, even during active calls, by using pre-gathered service information.
  * If the initial connection attempt fails, the mobile terminal can scan frequency channels or start a conventional connection procedure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention simplifies the production of multilayered electrical components.
  * Eliminates costly steps 4 and 6 in conventional processes.
  * Focuses on producing multilayer capacitors, coils, resistances, or combinations.
  * Aims to reduce labor and production costs.

* The process involves creating laminate sub-assemblies.
  * First and second electrodes are placed in recesses of electrical components.
  * Sub-assemblies are stacked to form a resultant assembly.
  * Decals are used to facilitate precise stacking and registration.

* The invention addresses issues with conventional multilayer capacitors.
  * Reduces delamination caused by density variations.
  * Eliminates cutting stress cracks.
  * Allows for smaller and more reliable parts.

* The process allows for in-process inspection and control.
  * Enables inspection of electrode and dielectric prints before assembly.
  * Uses Electro-Therm inks for efficient transfer and processing.
  * Facilitates statistical determination of dielectric constant before production.

* The invention supports a variety of electronic configurations.
  * Can produce capacitors, coils, and resistors in one stack.
  * Allows for different sizes and shapes of components.
  * Supports high production rates at low cost.

* The process includes the use of flexible decals.
  * Decals are prepared with guide holes for accurate registration.
  * Decals are coated with a transfer release agent for easy removal.
  * Decals can be stored as inventory for rapid production response.

* The invention enables the production of multilayer ferrite inductors.
  * Uses spiral coil electrode patterns for coil formation.
  * Stacks laminates to form complete coil structures.
  * Eliminates the need for laborious coil winding.

* The process is adaptable to other electronic ceramic devices.
  * Can be used for multilayer substrates with buried circuitry.
  * Suitable for semiconductor packages like dual line configurations.

<summary>

• The invention relates to hierarchical cellular lattice structures used in sandwich panels for structural applications.
   • These structures are lightweight yet provide high specific stiffness and strength.
   • They are applicable in various fields, including transportation, ballistics, and construction.
   • The invention includes methods for manufacturing these structures.

• The lattice structures consist of unit cells of varying sizes, forming a hierarchical framework.
   • First-order cells have the longest ligaments, with subsequent orders having progressively shorter ligaments.
   • The structures can be made from various materials, including metals, polymers, and ceramics.
   • The design allows for nesting and mating of arrays to form complex structures.

• The invention includes methods for forming lattice structures using injection molding and other techniques.
   • Injection molding can be used to create unit cells from thermoplastic polymers.
   • The process can also involve metal or ceramic injection molding.
   • The resulting structures can be used as templates for further processing.

• The invention describes methods for nesting and mating lattice structures to enhance their properties.
   • Nesting involves aligning ligaments of different order cells to form a cohesive structure.
   • Mating involves aligning ligaments of oppositely oriented lattice structures.
   • These processes result in balanced or mated lattice structures with improved performance.

• The invention includes methods for applying face sheets to lattice structures.
   • Face sheets can be attached to the top, bottom, or sides of the lattice structure.
   • They can be attached using various bonding methods, such as welding or adhesive bonding.
   • The face sheets enhance the structural integrity and functionality of the lattice structures.

• The invention provides methods for using lattice structures in various applications.
   • They can be used in sandwich panels for transportation, armor, and construction.
   • The structures offer improved impact and blast load mitigation.
   • They can also be used for heat exchange and as support systems for catalysts.

• The invention includes methods for manufacturing lattice structures using investment casting.
   • A polymeric unit cell array is used as a template for casting.
   • The process involves creating a hollow negative template and filling it with molten metal.
   • The resulting metal unit cell array can be tested for structural soundness.

• The invention describes various methods for manufacturing tetrahedral unit cells.
   • Hexagons with tabs are deformed using a die and punch tool assembly.
   • The unit cells can be nested and joined to form a hierarchical truss core network.
   • The resulting sandwich panels exhibit significant improvements in strength.

• The

<summary>
• The invention integrates an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) process with a Coal-to-Liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis facility to co-produce power and hydrocarbons.
  • The process involves both wet and dry gasification stages, with wet gasification producing combustion gas for power generation and dry gasification producing synthesis gas for hydrocarbon synthesis.
  • The integration aims to optimize economies of scale, reduce costs, and enhance environmental benefits by capturing and utilizing CO2 emissions.
  • The process includes various stages such as gas clean-up, Fischer-Tropsch synthesis, and waste heat recovery to maximize efficiency and output.

• The wet gasification stage uses water as a carrier for coal, producing combustion gas at high pressure, which is then used for power generation.
  • A portion of the combustion gas is enriched with hydrogen and mixed with synthesis gas precursor from the dry gasification stage for hydrocarbon synthesis.
  • The combustion gas is cleaned and expanded through turbines to generate electricity, with waste heat recovery further enhancing energy efficiency.
  • The process also involves CO2 and water separation, with CO2 being compressed for sequestration or further use.

• The dry gasification stage uses gas as a carrier for coal, producing synthesis gas precursor at a pressure suitable for Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis.
  • The synthesis gas is cleaned to remove impurities and then converted to hydrocarbons using Fischer-Tropsch synthesis stages.
  • The process includes hydrogen recycling and CO2 removal to optimize the synthesis gas composition and reduce emissions.
  • Hydrocarbon products are worked up to produce LPG, naphtha, and diesel, with by-products being utilized within the process.

• The integration of IGCC and CTL facilities allows for shared utilities and resources, improving overall efficiency and reducing costs.
  • The shared air separation unit provides oxygen for both facilities, enhancing energy efficiency and lowering operational costs.
  • Fuel gas from the CTL facility is used in the IGCC facility, providing an internal consumer for the gas and improving steam production.
  • The integration also facilitates CO2 capture from the IGCC facility's off-gas, contributing to environmental sustainability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on improving the reliability of oxide superconducting materials by addressing surface deterioration issues.
  * A passivation film is applied to the surface to prevent oxygen loss, maintaining superconductivity at the surface level.
  * Various methods, including photo-CVD, are used to apply films and control oxygen concentration, enhancing the material's superconducting properties.

* The invention provides examples of different materials and methods used to create the passivation film.
  * Silicon nitride, silicon oxide, and aluminum films are used, with specific conditions for each to optimize oxygen concentration.
  * The process involves forming a film, adding oxygen, and heat treating to ensure uniform oxygen distribution and improved superconductivity.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention pertains to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, ensuring precise and undistorted samples.
    • The apparatus allows for the creation of uniform, parallel-sided foam samples using a thin cutting blade, crucial for examining the cell structure without damage.
• The apparatus includes a base structure, clamping mechanism, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism for precise sample preparation.
    • It features a base plate, support columns, a clamp bar, and a hand nut mechanism to facilitate controlled sample advancement and cutting.
• The invention aids in quality control by providing samples for microscopic examination, revealing insights into foam material properties.
    • It helps identify differences in foam materials, such as brittleness or flexibility, and ensures even light transmission during examination.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers, specifically ocean bottom seismometers (OBS), and addresses challenges in determining their angle of inclination and leveling on the ocean floor.
  * OBS units are used in geological research and oil exploration, facing unique challenges due to their deployment method and ocean floor conditions.
* The invention provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination of a seismometer on the ocean floor.
  * This knowledge helps in understanding the ocean floor contour and evaluating data accuracy.
* The invention includes a self-leveling mechanism for seismic motion detectors in a seismometer.
  * It uses a pendulum system with a ball and shaft to align detectors automatically.
* The apparatus features a spring-loaded plunger to lock the position of the seismic detectors.
  * The plunger is activated by a solenoid, ensuring the detectors remain in their operational position.
* The invention improves seismic coupling between the ocean floor and the detector.
  * This is achieved through a rigid connection between the detector and the seismometer frame.
* The invention is designed to be simple and inexpensive compared to previous methods like gimbals or floating systems.
  * It uses a clamping device to preserve the orientation of the detectors.
* The invention includes a method for measuring the angle of inclination after recovery.
  * The angle is determined by measuring the acute angle formed by the locked position of the ball, shaft, and detector.
* The invention is compatible with various seismic motion detectors, including vertical and horizontal types.
  * Detectors are mounted to ensure their operating axis aligns with the pendulum's vertical line.
* The invention can be integrated with existing seismometer systems, using acoustic commands or timers for operation.
  * It is adaptable to different deployment and recovery methods used in ocean exploration.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention introduces a new humidity sensing element that is more responsive, sturdy, and accurate compared to traditional sensors.
  • It uses a combination of anodized aluminum, nickel particles, and a dielectric layer to measure humidity changes.
  • The sensor is designed to be non-hygroscopic, quick to respond, and resistant to environmental contaminants.

• The manufacturing process involves anodizing aluminum, depositing nickel particles, and forming a second electrode through vacuum deposition.
  • The anodized layer is treated to create a porous structure that holds nickel particles, enhancing the sensor's sensitivity.
  • The second electrode is formed by depositing nickel, ensuring it remains pervious to moisture vapor.

• The sensor's impedance changes linearly with humidity, making it suitable for precise humidity control applications.
  • It combines capacitance and resistance properties to respond to humidity and temperature changes.
  • The sensor is optimized for use with a 10 Hertz AC voltage to maintain linearity in its response.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly with an improved force transmission structure.
  * The structure includes a drive plate with a mounting hole and a shaft with a toothed portion.
  * The mounting hole and toothed portion are Y-shaped for stable rotation.
  * The drive plate is preferably made of plastics for strength and noise reduction.

* The motor assembly comprises a motor, a gear train, and a force transmission structure.
  * The gear train includes a worm, worm gear, and damper.
  * The drive plate is driven by the worm gear through the damper.
  * The shaft is held in place by a circlip to prevent escape from the mounting hole.

* The drive plate features a coupling with buffer holes and protrusions.
  * The coupling is deeper than the body of the drive plate.
  * Buffer holes aid in reducing distortion during molding.
  * Protrusions engage with the damper for rotation.

* The shaft includes a toothed portion and a pinion for driving a gear.
  * The toothed portion has three teeth for stable force distribution.
  * The pinion connects to a window lift system.
  * The shaft is made of low alloy steel for durability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to wireless communication systems, specifically for detecting, identifying, and monitoring multipath signals in WCDMA systems.
    • Multipath signals are identical signals reaching the receiver at different times due to different paths.
    • The invention aims to improve signal detection and monitoring in 3G systems.
    • 3G systems aim to increase transmission speeds and add mobile dimensions to services like Internet access.
    • The invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for portable transceivers.

• The system includes an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem.
    • The radio frequency subsystem has high and low frequency oscillators.
    • The baseband subsystem includes a free running counter for mobile time reference.
    • The counter uses the high frequency oscillator in wake mode and the low frequency oscillator in sleep mode.
    • The system maintains mobile time reference accuracy during sleep mode.

• The invention provides a method for generating a mobile time reference.
    • It involves providing high and low frequency clocks.
    • The mobile time reference is generated using the high frequency clock.
    • It is maintained using the low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is unavailable.
    • The reference continues with the high frequency clock when it becomes available again.

• The invention includes a detailed description of a 3G portable transceiver.
    • The transceiver includes an antenna, RF subsystem, and baseband subsystem.
    • The RF subsystem has components like a receiver, transmitter, and oscillators.
    • The baseband subsystem includes a WCDMA modem, microprocessor, and memory.
    • Peripheral interfaces connect the transceiver to devices like speakers and computers.

• The WCDMA modem includes a free running counter for mobile time reference.
    • The counter operates in two time domains: active and idle modes.
    • In active mode, the transceiver is actively transmitting or receiving signals.
    • In idle mode, the transceiver conserves power by powering down circuits.
    • The mobile time reference is maintained during idle mode for quick transition to active mode.

• The invention provides a multipath signal recovery system.
    • It includes components like a multipath monitor and radio signal recovery circuit.
    • The system aligns signals from asynchronous base stations for efficient recovery.
    • It uses a Kalman estimation for clock drift and bias recovery.
    • The system reduces power consumption and improves signal detection efficiency.

• The invention offers a method for maintaining mobile time reference.
    • A high

<summary>
* The invention relates to protective helmets with hard outer shells and resilient liners to absorb shock.
  * Traditional liners use adjustable straps, causing wobbling and fit issues.
* Previous methods for custom-fitted liners involve complex processes and are not adjustable for different wearers.
  * Morton and Chisum patents describe methods with limitations like handling foaming agents and complexity.
* The invention aims to provide a helmet liner that is simple, inexpensive, and easily adjustable.
  * The liner uses elastic thermoplastic sheets with open pockets for deformation and fitting.
* The liner can be refitted to accommodate changes in head size without trimming.
  * It eliminates the need for drawstrings by maintaining compression during fitting.
* The liner consists of multiple layers of thermoplastic sheets with pockets that deform under pressure.
  * The sheets are heated to a plastic state for fitting and cooled to retain the shape.
* The liner is designed to resist shifting on the wearer's head.
  * It conforms to the head's contours, minimizing movement.
* The manufacturing process is simplified by not requiring precise alignment of layers.
  * The open pockets allow for compliance and accommodation between layers.
* The liner can be custom-fitted by heating and pressing it onto the wearer's head.
  * It can be refitted for different individuals or head size changes within the same range.
* The invention achieves its objectives of simplicity, cost-effectiveness, and ease of use.
  * It allows for repeated adjustments and accommodates various head sizes and shapes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a multiorifice wafer structure for atomizing fuel in automotive injectors.
    • It addresses the challenge of manufacturing small aperture multiorifice structures cost-effectively.
    • Prior methods like drilling and photoetching are impractical for achieving uniformity in small apertures.
    • The invention offers a method using fused concentric layers of rods and cylindrical members.

• The multiorifice structure features angularly disposed passageways.
    • The angles of these passageways increase with distance from the center.
    • This design enhances the atomization and dispersion of the fluid.
    • The structure is sliced into thin wafers to form the final product.

• The method involves fusing concentric layers of rods and cylindrical members.
    • Each layer of rods is disposed at progressively larger angles.
    • The assembly is sliced to create multiple multiorifice structures.
    • The interstices between rods and cylinders form angular passageways.

• The triangular orifices improve fluid atomization compared to circular ones.
    • Surface tension causes the fluid to oscillate and break into droplets.
    • The triangular shape enhances this effect, leading to better atomization.
    • The uniformity of apertures is achieved through precise extrusion techniques.

• The fabrication process is simple and economical.
    • It involves twisting rods around a core and sheathing them in cylindrical members.
    • The assembly is fused or sintered to form an integral structure.
    • Coating materials with lower melting points can facilitate fusion.

• The invention allows for variations in design and materials.
    • Cylindrical members can have alternate shapes.
    • Rods can have noncircular cross-sections or multiple layers.
    • Materials like metals, glass, or plastics can be used.
    • The invention is not limited to the described configuration or method.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on improving the manufacturing process of semiconductor devices, specifically MOS field effect devices with a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure.
  * The method addresses issues with conventional LDD structures, such as difficulty in controlling the oxide portion width on the gate sidewall and degradation due to hot-carrier injection.

* The invention proposes forming an insulating film on the gate electrode and substrate, followed by a layer that is anisotropically etched to leave a portion on the gate sidewall.
  * This process allows for better control over the width of the oxide portion, preventing issues like etching away the source/drain region.

* Various embodiments of the invention are described, each offering different methods for forming the LDD structure.
  * These include using polycrystalline silicon, high melting point metals, or silicides to form the sidewall portion, and employing low-temperature processes to prevent degradation.

* The invention also includes methods for siliciding portions of the gate electrode and source/drain regions to reduce resistance and prevent transconductance degradation.
  * This approach allows for the derivation of hot carriers through the gate electrode, improving device performance and enabling the creation of smaller devices.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved end-user interface for Internet-protocol (IP) telephone communication.
  * Current IP telephones require high-performance PCs and additional sound equipment.
  * The invention provides an enhanced radio telephone that can be used as an improved IP telephone.
  * It offers a low-cost solution with reduced speech delay and echo problems.

* The enhanced radio telephone can operate as both a conventional radio telephone and an IP telephone.
  * It includes an internal speech coder for low power consumption.
  * The device can be connected to a PC via cable or wireless connection.
  * The PC performs conversions between coded speech signals and network protocols.

* The invention allows for IP-telephone control from either the PC or the enhanced radio telephone.
  * Switching between modes can be manual or automatic.
  * Calls can be initiated using either the PC or the radio telephone keypad.
  * The system is more convenient and efficient than conventional IP telephones.

* The invention includes alternative embodiments for wireless data communication.
  * Coded speech is formatted by the PC and transmitted via a wireless network interface.
  * The PC serial port can carry digital speech, control signaling, and IP data.
  * The invention provides an economical and efficient IP telephone solution.

* The invention offers several advantages over conventional IP telephony systems.
  * It eliminates the need for high-end PCs and additional sound equipment.
  * The enhanced radio telephone provides a comfortable handset for users.
  * Echo problems are significantly reduced compared to conventional systems.

* The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described.
  * The scope is defined by the appended claims.
  * Various equivalent embodiments are contemplated.
  * The invention can be adapted to different cost and performance requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention focuses on wave energy converters that utilize submerged devices to harness energy from surface waves, enhancing efficiency through wave focusing and floating bodies.
  * It addresses the limitations of existing ocean wave energy converters (OWECs), such as high costs and low efficiency, by proposing a design that is adjustable for tides and severe sea-states, and captures both hydrostatic and hydrokinetic energy.

* The invention features gas-tight containers submerged below wave troughs, with a fixed and a movable end connected by a flexible, reinforced bellows.
  * The containers expand and contract due to wave-induced pressure variations, with energy capture enhanced by partial evacuation or atmospheric venting, and the motion is converted into useful work through hydraulic, pneumatic, or mechanical means.

* The design offers significant improvements over prior art, such as reduced mass, increased stroke length, and enhanced energy capture efficiency.
  * It eliminates the need for heavy, high-maintenance components like rolling membrane seals and ectoskeletons, and allows for depth adjustment to optimize energy capture and survivability.

* The invention can be configured in various orientations and includes features like wave reflection and focusing to increase energy capture.
  * It can be used in different configurations, such as vertically or horizontally, and can incorporate floating devices to further enhance energy capture.

* The invention's embodiments include features like inclined shoaling planes, wave reflective walls, and surface vent buoys to maximize energy capture.
  * These features work together to increase wave height and kinetic energy capture, with the potential to produce significant electrical power outputs.
</summary>

<summary>  
• The invention relates to scraped surface heat exchangers, focusing on blade mounting on the central drive shaft.  
    • Scraped surface heat exchangers are used in industries like food processing.  
    • They consist of a cylindrical outer tube with a central drive shaft.  
    • Blades are hingedly connected to the drive shaft to mix materials and prevent buildup.  
    • The invention addresses challenges in blade mounting and installation.  
  
• Traditional blade mounting involves pins welded onto the drive shaft.  
    • Blades have holes to fit over the pins, allowing angular movement.  
    • Installation requires the drive shaft to be removed from the outer tube.  
    • Blades must be held at a shallow angle during installation.  
    • The process can be cumbersome, especially for vertical heat exchangers.  
  
• The invention introduces a new blade design with L-shaped locking tracks.  
    • The blade has a scraper edge, hinge edge, and mounting holes.  
    • L-shaped tracks on both sides of the blade guide the pins during installation.  
    • The design prevents blades from sliding off pins during installation.  
    • It ensures correct blade orientation and scraper edge alignment.  
  
• The invention allows for easier and more secure blade installation.  
    • Blades can be installed with the correct side facing up.  
    • The design prevents blades from falling off pins in vertical configurations.  
    • Blades can pivot freely without sliding off the pins.  
    • Removal requires lifting the blade to a specific position.  
  
• The invention provides structural rigidity and reduces wear.  
    • Tracks on both sides of the blade maintain structural integrity.  
    • The design balances clearance for sliding and interference for locking.  
    • It reduces the amount of thinned track blade area.  
    • The invention accommodates wear over time for both blades and pins.  
  
• The invention is adaptable to various configurations and orientations.  
    • It can be used in both horizontal and vertical heat exchangers.  
    • The design is not limited to specific construction details.  
    • It allows for modifications and variations within the invention's scope.  
    • The invention can be a basis for designing other structures and systems.  
  
• The invention includes detailed illustrations and descriptions.  
    • Figures show different views of the blade and pin assembly.  
    • The installation process is depicted step-by-step.  
    • The drawings highlight key features and components.  
    • The detailed description aids in understanding the

<summary>
* The invention addresses detecting and eliminating defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in cigarette production and packaging machines.
    * Cigarettes can become transversely located, blocking shafts and causing disruptions.
    * Manual removal by operators is prone to human error and is labor-intensive.
    * The invention aims to improve disruption avoidance in cigarette magazines.
    * An optical checking element, like a camera, is used for detection.

* The detection process involves capturing images of cigarettes and evaluating them against reference images or values.
    * An error signal is generated if deviations are detected.
    * The process monitors a large area of cigarettes for better orientation overview.
    * Image processing can also identify defective cigarettes, such as missing filters.
    * Detected disruptions can be addressed manually or automatically.

* The elimination process involves ejecting defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes.
    * An ejecting unit is actuated to remove cigarettes in an assigned ejecting zone.
    * Multiple adjacent ejecting zones and units allow targeted ejection.
    * The number of ejected cigarettes ensures complete removal of transversely located ones.
    * Ejected cigarettes are recycled, minimizing tobacco waste.

* The apparatus includes a cigarette magazine with a camera and ejecting units.
    * The camera scans images of the cigarette magazine for evaluation.
    * Ejecting units are actuated based on error signals from image processing.
    * Ejected cigarettes are collected in a chute for recycling.
    * The apparatus can be manually or automatically triggered for ejection.

* The cigarette magazine has a storage part and shaft groups for cigarette alignment.
    * Cigarettes move downwards due to gravity into shaft groups.
    * Oscillating rods ensure uniform downward movement.
    * Incorrectly positioned cigarettes can cause blockages.
    * The camera monitors cigarette ends through a transparent wall.

* The ejecting unit consists of a housing, carriage, and ejector.
    * The ejector has front and rear walls connected by a rod.
    * In the through position, cigarettes pass without obstruction.
    * In the ejecting position, cigarettes are pushed into the chute.
    * The housing-like device prevents cigarette blockage during ejection.

* Evaluation zones correspond to regions monitored by the camera.
    * Each evaluation zone is linked to an ejecting zone.
    * The camera captures images of all evaluation zones for processing.
    * Detected errors trigger corresponding ejecting units.
    * Time delay allows cigarettes to move from evaluation to ejecting zones.

* The invention allows for manual or automatic error elimination.

<summary>
* The invention provides a simplified connection system for high voltage cables, applicable to various accessories and interconnections, offering advantages like factory pretesting, reduced installation time and cost, and simplified field testing.
  * The system is designed for cables with ratings up to 400 KV and above, with a common interface for cable ends and accessories.
  * The interface components do not include gas or oil, eliminating risks of leaks or explosions.

* Three interface methods are described: inner cone, outer cone, and no cone/slight inner cone, with the outer cone concept offering advantages like better separation from connected apparatus.
  * The outer cone concept is preferred for its ability to expand rubber materials more easily and reduce the impact of faults.
  * The inner cone concept allows for shorter solutions outside SF6 cubicles, while plane surface interconnections simplify alignment.

* The invention includes various applications such as SF6 terminals, transformer terminals, outdoor terminals, straight through joints, transition joints, and apparatus joints.
  * SF6 terminals use a compact design with a rigid epoxy body, offering lower material and installation costs.
  * Transformer terminals and outdoor terminals eliminate the need for oil or SF6-filled insulators, enhancing safety and maintaining mechanical rigidity.

* The outer surface configuration of the rigid insulator is crucial for optimizing product reliability in high voltage installations, with a conical interface surface angle between 15° and 45°.
  * The detailed description of embodiments serves as examples and should not limit the scope of protection.
  * The invention aims to standardize connections and improve safety and efficiency in high voltage cable installations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention introduces a fixing mechanism for tools used in material treatment, such as machining, which includes a tool, its frame, and a tool holder within a machine tool frame.
  * The mechanism is applicable in various technologies, including machining by chipping and robot applications, and is particularly beneficial for sheet machining centers.
  * It addresses the limitations of prior art, such as the Morse conic fit, by providing a simpler and more secure fixing mechanism using curved connecting surfaces.
  * The invention aims to improve tool-fixing mechanisms by ensuring secure transmission of machining forces through contact surfaces that are perpendicular to the mounting direction.

* The detailed description outlines the components and operation of the fixing mechanism, including various embodiments and their specific features.
  * The mechanism includes a tool, tool frame, bushing-like tool holder, and clamps, with connecting surfaces designed to transmit forces effectively.
  * Different embodiments illustrate the use of spherical and curvilinear surfaces for secure tool mounting and release, with specific design parameters for optimal performance.
  * The mechanism allows for easy tool exchange and secure fixation, reducing complexity and potential disturbances during machining operations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides methods and apparatus for generating supply voltages for display driver circuits with high efficiency and low electromagnetic interference (EMI).
  * It utilizes modified switching regulator circuits with multiple circuit paths carrying electric current in opposite directions to cancel out radiated noise, and includes terminal lines to sink any EMI generated in the outermost paths.

* The invention is particularly useful for driving large displays, such as those on Apple iPhones, without the typical EMI issues.
  * The design includes interleaved source and drain paths to cancel EMI and additional terminal paths to further reduce EMI effects, ensuring efficient operation with minimal noise.
</summary>

<summary>
* Vehicle battery rebalancing and charging process
  * The process involves measuring cell voltages, identifying the minimum voltage cell, and bleeding down other cells to match this voltage before charging.
  * A power system with a controller can adjust the charge rate among cells to equalize voltages over a set period.
  * Up to 50% of the total time for rebalancing and charging can be spent on rebalancing, with techniques proposed to minimize this time.

* Calculating cell energy content and charge time
  * Cell energy content is calculated using equations involving power, voltage, and current, with adjustments for state of charge.
  * The charge time for a battery pack depends on the cell with the greatest capacity change needed and the method of balancing cell voltages.
  * Algorithms are provided for determining cell voltages, charge times, and resistive circuitry activation to achieve desired drive ranges.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an AC-to-DC converter designed as a lamp power supply that provides a constant DC voltage, eliminating flicker and electromagnetic radiation to reduce eye fatigue and protect eyesight.
  • It addresses issues with existing lamp power supplies that cause flicker and health risks due to low and high-frequency outputs.

• The converter includes various components such as an input protection circuit, EMI filter, rectifier, and feedback and dimming circuit, which work together to maintain a constant output voltage and brightness.
  • The design allows for flexibility in component arrangement and integration, ensuring adaptability to different circuit requirements.

• The invention can be implemented using various topologies and controllers, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, including lighting, computer power supplies, and battery chargers.
  • It emphasizes power factor correction and the ability to adjust output voltage and lamp brightness through a potentiometer.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system for automatic control of lighting levels in a space, managing both electric and natural light to maintain a consistent illumination profile and reduce sun glare.
		• The system divides the space into zones, using sensors to control electric lamps and window treatments.
		• It aims to maintain a desired lighting profile and minimize sun glare, especially at low sun angles.

• The system uses both open loop and closed loop control methods for electric lights and window treatments.
		• Open loop control uses interior sensors to predominantly sense daylight.
		• Closed loop control uses sensors to sense a combination of daylight and electric light.

• The invention eliminates the need for exterior sensors and complex setup procedures, reducing system costs.
		• It allows for recalibration based on occupant input, enhancing satisfaction.
		• The system can maximize daylight savings by adjusting window treatments only during glare incidents.

• The system can operate using a single photosensor or averaged readings from multiple sensors.
		• This input is used for closed loop control of window treatments and open loop control of electric lights.
		• It simplifies the control process by using a single input variable.

• The system includes a central processor, dimming panel, photosensor interfaces, and motorized window treatments.
		• It can manage lighting for an entire facility, allowing custom preset scenes for different activities.
		• The processor can control up to 512 zones and 544 scenes.

• The system uses a fixed number of presets for electric light control, such as Minimum, Medium Low, Medium High, and Maximum.
		• Presets are configured based on daylight availability and desired illumination levels.
		• The system adjusts electric lights between presets to maintain the desired lighting profile.

• The system employs a dead-band control method for window treatments to reduce sun glare.
		• It uses a variable control setpoint based on sun angle to address glare issues.
		• The system adjusts window treatments only when light levels are outside the dead-band.

• The system can adjust setpoints based on time of day and sun angle to optimize glare control.
		• It uses an astronomic time clock to determine sunrise and sunset times.
		• Setpoints are adjusted to account for changes in daylight intensity throughout the day.

• The system allows for manual control of window treatments, accounting for user overrides.
		• It ensures that manual adjustments do not interfere with automatic control.
		• The system can revert to automatic control after manual adjustments are made.

<summary>
* The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) was created to address aviation security vulnerabilities identified before September 2001, including issues with passenger and baggage screening, airport access controls, and air traffic control systems.
  * TSA took over screening responsibilities from airlines, deploying federal screeners and explosives detection technology at airports.
  * The agency faced challenges such as high turnover rates, insufficient training, and operational issues in meeting security deadlines.

* TSA implemented several initiatives to enhance security, including the Transportation Workers Identification Card (TWIC) program and the Computer Assisted Passenger Prescreening System (CAPPS II).
  * TWIC aims to standardize secure identification for transportation workers, while CAPPS II assesses passenger risk levels using personal information.
  * Concerns about privacy and operational feasibility have been raised, requiring further examination and resolution.

* TSA and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) have worked to improve air traffic control security and address vulnerabilities in air cargo, general aviation, and airport perimeter security.
  * The "known shipper" program and other measures aim to secure air cargo, but comprehensive plans and risk management approaches are needed.
  * General aviation remains vulnerable, with voluntary security guidance issued but limited action taken to improve security.

* Funding and accountability challenges persist, with TSA's budget not fully covering aviation security costs and issues with contractor oversight.
  * TSA has reprogrammed funds, raising concerns about accountability and the impact on programs like the Federal Air Marshal Service.
  * Proposed legislation seeks to establish dedicated funding for security-related capital investments and research and development.

* TSA's efforts to coordinate with federal, state, and local agencies and the aviation community are crucial for effective security partnerships.
  * Clear roles and responsibilities, effective communication, and intelligence sharing are needed to address potential threats.
  * Coordination challenges include conflicts between TSA and airport officials and the need for better integration of watch lists.

* TSA faces strategic human capital management challenges, including workforce size, training, and performance management.
  * The agency plans to reduce its screener workforce and improve efficiency with new technologies and processes.
  * Concerns remain about background checks, training, and the effectiveness of the Federal Air Marshal Service.

* TSA is adopting a risk management approach to prioritize security efforts and allocate resources effectively.
  * Tools like the Transportation Risk Assessment and Vulnerability Evaluation (TRAVEL) are being developed to assess threats and vulnerabilities.
  * Comprehensive risk-based assessments are essential for planning and resource allocation across transportation modes.

* TSA's long-term success depends on building a results-oriented

<summary>
* The Lobbying Disclosure Act (LDA) and IRC sections 4911 and 162(e) were enacted at different times for distinct purposes, with LDA focusing on federal lobbying disclosure and IRC sections addressing tax implications of lobbying.
  * LDA requires organizations lobbying federal officials to register and report expenditures semiannually, aiming for transparency in lobbying activities.
  * IRC section 4911 limits lobbying by 501(c)(3) organizations to protect their tax-exempt status, while section 162(e) denies tax deductibility of certain lobbying expenses for businesses.
  * LDA includes specific registration thresholds and definitions for lobbying activities, differing from IRC definitions.

* LDA and IRC definitions differ significantly in their coverage of lobbying activities and officials, affecting registration and reporting requirements.
  * LDA covers only federal lobbying, while IRC definitions include state and local lobbying and grassroots efforts.
  * LDA requires reporting of contacts with a broader range of federal officials on nonlegislative matters compared to IRC definitions.
  * The choice of definition affects which organizations must register and what information they must disclose.

* Organizations can choose between LDA and IRC definitions for calculating lobbying expenses, impacting registration and reporting.
  * Using IRC definitions may result in lower reported expenses, potentially avoiding LDA registration thresholds.
  * Organizations can switch definitions annually, affecting the comparability and scope of disclosed lobbying activities.
  * The choice of definition can lead to inconsistent reporting, undermining LDA's purpose of transparency in federal lobbying.

* Differences in definitions can lead to organizations reporting expenses unrelated to LDA's focus on federal lobbying.
  * IRC definitions include state, local, and grassroots lobbying expenses, which may not align with LDA's federal focus.
  * Organizations using IRC definitions might report less information on federal lobbying than intended by LDA.
  * The inclusion of nonfederal lobbying expenses can obscure the extent of federal lobbying efforts.

* Options for addressing inconsistencies in definitions include harmonizing definitions or restricting the use of IRC definitions for LDA purposes.
  * Harmonizing definitions would require revisiting fundamental legislative decisions and could alter LDA's objectives.
  * Eliminating the option to use IRC definitions would ensure consistent reporting under LDA but increase the burden on some organizations.
  * Requiring organizations using IRC definitions to report only federal lobbying expenses could improve alignment with LDA's purpose.

* The report suggests that the trade-offs involved in harmonizing definitions may not justify the changes, given the small number of organizations using IRC definitions.
  *

<summary>
• GAO has been evaluating strategic sourcing in federal acquisitions for over a decade, highlighting its potential for cost savings and efficiency.
  • Strategic sourcing involves tactics like leveraged buying, demand management, and supplier relationship management.
  • Comprehensive spend analysis is crucial for efficient procurement, yet federal agencies struggle with decentralized procurement and data challenges.

• The Federal Strategic Sourcing Initiative (FSSI) was established in 2005 to address government-wide sourcing opportunities.
  • Despite efforts, only a small fraction of federal procurement spending is managed through strategic sourcing.
  • Agencies face challenges like lack of leadership commitment, expertise, and clear metrics for success.

• Leading companies have successfully applied strategic sourcing to services, achieving significant savings.
  • Companies analyze procurement spending rigorously and tailor tactics based on service complexity and supplier availability.
  • Centralizing procurement knowledge, not activity, and developing category-specific strategies are key practices.

• OMB and other agencies have taken steps to expand strategic sourcing, but more progress is needed.
  • Agencies are encouraged to strategically source new products or services and reinforce leadership commitment.
  • Adopting leading practices can help federal agencies achieve cost savings and improve procurement efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>
* Current surface transportation programs are ineffective and lack a clear federal role.
  * Many programs are not linked to performance, with funds distributed through formulas unrelated to needs.
  * The federal role has expanded without a well-defined vision, leading to numerous and sometimes conflicting goals.
